availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edwin T. Taylor (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and miller)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and miller. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann S. Day Taylor in Butler County, Kentucky, on August 25, 1842. Father of Mary H. Taylor, William G. Taylor, D. Welbourn Taylor, Elizabeth A. Taylor, and Hubbard Taylor. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Farmer and miller in Clark County in 1860. Employed John Fletcher as a miller in Clark County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 11A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 832.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 341B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Precinct 4, p. 45A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Butler County Marriages, Film #000367208, p. 45.
